intro: Helosciadium wallichianum, commonly known as the Himalayan toothbrush, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
